body:
> [!NOTE] > ## Other AI code review bot(s) detected > > CodeRabbit has detected other AI code review bot(s) in this pull request and will avoid duplicating their findings in the review comments. This may lead to a less comprehensive review. ## Walkthrough Adds documentation and example env, Docker orchestration and images (GPU/CPU) for processing and viewer, new Flask app factories, a processing status UI, full SQLAlchemy schema, auth/admin/demo tooling, TeamSnap and email integrations, heatmap/statistics/social-export services, and related routes and Docker/nginx entrypoint scripts. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Env & Docs**
`\.env.example`, `ARCHITECTURE.md`, `TODO.md`, `soccer-rig-server/docs/TEAMSNAP_SCHEMA.md` | New example environment file and multiple documentation files describing architecture, TODO items, and TeamSnap schema. | | **Orchestration**
`docker-compose.yml` | New docker-compose defining viewer, processing (GPU/CPU options), db (Postgres), redis, celery, volumes, network, SSL mounts, and optional GPU reservation. | | **Processing Images & Deps**
`processing-server/Dockerfile`, `processing-server/Dockerfile.cpu`, `processing-server/requirements.txt` | Added GPU and CPU Dockerfiles for the processing server and updated requirements (added gunicorn, psutil); builds YOLO model at image-build time. | | **Processing App & Status UI**
`processing-server/src/processing_server/__init__.py`, `processing-server/src/processing_server/app.py`, `processing-server/src/processing_server/web/*` | New WSGI factory `create_app()`, change to ProcessingPipeline initialization, background processing start, and a Flask status UI with API, in-memory job queue, GPU/system introspection, template, and CSS. | | **Viewer Image, Entrypoint & Nginx**
`soccer-rig-server/Dockerfile`, `soccer-rig-server/docker/entrypoint.sh`, `soccer-rig-server/docker/nginx.conf` | New multi-stage viewer Dockerfile, entrypoint script handling SSL (Let’s Encrypt/self-signed), DB readiness/migrations, and a comprehensive nginx configuration (rate limits, static/storage, upload tuning, proxy rules). | | **Viewer App Factory & Config**
`soccer-rig-server/app.py`, `\.env.example` | New Flask `create_app()` wiring environment-driven configuration, DB init, CORS, route registration, health/analytics endpoints; `.env.example` added/updated. | | **DB Models & Utilities**
`soccer-rig-server/src/models.py` | New comprehensive SQLAlchemy schema (User, Player, Organization, Team, Game, Recording, GameEvent, Clip, PlayerGameStats, PlayerSeasonStats, Notification), enums, association tables, and DB helpers. | | **Authentication & User Routes**
`soccer-rig-server/src/auth.py` | New auth module with login/register/logout, session handling, dashboard, player/profile routes, settings, APIs, and embedded templates. | | **Admin & Config Management**
`soccer-rig-server/src/admin.py` | New admin subsystem including generated/persisted admin password, `ConfigManager`, admin routes (login, dashboard, config, password reset), health endpoint, and inline admin UIs. | | **Demo Data**
`soccer-rig-server/src/demo_data.py` | Demo data generator/deleter and admin routes to create/delete demo organizations, teams, players, games, events, clips, and stats. | | **Integrations — TeamSnap**
`soccer-rig-server/src/integrations/teamsnap.py`, `soccer-rig-server/src/integrations/__init__.py` | New TeamSnap OAuth2 client, token/team/player/game dataclasses, sync service, OAuth/sync routes, data-explorer and schedule UIs, and JSONB storage integration. | | **Integrations — Email**
`soccer-rig-server/src/integrations/email.py` | New `EmailConfig`, `EmailService` with async worker and templating, and `NotificationDispatcher` supporting immediate and digest notification flows. | | **Services — Heatmap**
`soccer-rig-server/src/services/heatmap.py`, `soccer-rig-server/src/services/__init__.py` | New HeatMapService with grid generation, player/team/combined heatmaps, canvas output, API routes, and interactive viewer. | | **Services — Statistics**
`soccer-rig-server/src/services/statistics.py` | New StatisticsService and `PlayerStats` dataclass for recalculation, season aggregation, leaderboards, percentiles, history, and REST routes. | | **Services — Social Export**
`soccer-rig-server/src/services/social_export.py` | New SocialClipConfig and SocialMediaExporter for 9:16 exports and highlight reel composition (FFmpeg-based), plus routes and UI. | | **Processing App tweak**
`processing-server/src/processing_server/app.py` | Adjusted ProcessingPipeline initialization to pass full config to VideoStitcher (constructor argument change). | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram autonumber participant Client participant Nginx as "Nginx (Viewer)" participant Viewer as "Flask Viewer" participant DB as "Postgres" participant Queue as "Redis/Celery" participant Proc as "Processing Server" participant Storage as "Video Storage" participant Email as "Email Service" Client->>Nginx: Upload / user requests Nginx->>Viewer: POST /api/upload or page request Viewer->>DB: create Job/Recording record Viewer->>Queue: enqueue processing task (job_id) Queue->>Proc: deliver task Proc->>Storage: read input video files Proc->>Proc: stitching / ML processing -> generate clips Proc->>Storage: write artifacts (clips, thumbnails, panorama) Proc->>DB: update job, create Clip/metadata Proc->>Queue: enqueue notifications/stat tasks Viewer->>DB: read updated clips/metadata for UI Proc->>Email: dispatch notifications (immediate or queue for digest) Email->>DB: mark notifications sent (optional) Viewer->>Client: serve updated UI / clip links ``` ## Pre-merge checks
❌ Failed checks (1 inconclusive) | Check name | Status | Explanation | Resolution | | :---------: | :------------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Title check | ❓ Inconclusive | The pull request title is vague and uninformative, consisting primarily of random alphanumeric characters that do not convey the scope or nature of the substantial changes in this changeset. | Revise the title to clearly describe the primary change, such as 'Add Docker Compose setup, admin configuration, and email notification service' or 'Implement system architecture, database models, and multi-service deployment'. |
✅ Passed checks (2 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :----------------: | :------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Description Check | ✅ Passed | Check skipped - CodeRabbit’s high-level summary is enabled. | | Docstring Coverage | ✅ Passed | Docstring coverage is 82.32% which is sufficient. The required threshold is 80.00%. |
--- Thanks for using [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=cmc0619/Traloxolcus-Claude&utm_content=3)! It's free for OSS, and your support helps us grow. If you like it, consider giving us a shout-out.
❤️ Share - [X](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A&url=https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/share?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai) - [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/submit?title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&text=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai&mini=true&title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&summary=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code)

performed_via_github_app.name: coderabbitai
performed_via_github_app.description:
# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes. 

**Line-by-line review**: Provides line-by-line suggestions committable with one click.

**Codebase verification**:  Verifies the impact on the overall codebase and identifies missing changes.

**Insights into your code**:  Ask any questions on your codebase within the pull request 

**Chat about your code** : Chat with the bot around your code. The more you chat, the smarter it gets.

**Issue Validation**:  Validates the PR against the linked issues and identifies other related issues
